qas.question: What is a video-conference also known as?
What does a video-conference use that allows communication in live situations?
What is a multi-point control unit?
How does video-conferencing allow multiple parties to communicate with each other?
How many locations can one use videoconferencing for?
What is a web-based application more expensive than?
How does a videophone allow live communication?
What is a videophone also known as?
How many locations can you use a videophone in?

plausible_answers.text: multiple party videoconferencing via web-based applications

qas.question: What have videophones allowed by going around traditional definitions?

context: A videoconference system is generally higher cost than <b5_0>a videophone<b5_0/> and deploys greater capabilities. A videoconference (also known as a <a0_0><b7_0>videoteleconference<b7_0/><a0_0/>) allows <a4_0><b8_0>two or more<b8_0/><a4_0/> locations to communicate via live, simultaneous two-way video and audio transmissions. This is often accomplished by the use of <a1_0><b6_0>a multipoint control unit<b6_0/><a1_0/> (a centralized distribution and <a2_0>call management system<a2_0/>) or by a similar non-centralized multipoint capability embedded in each videoconferencing unit. Again, technology improvements have circumvented traditional definitions by allowing <b9_0>multiple party videoconferencing via <a3_0>web-based applications<b9_0/><a3_0/>.
